intro: Trimezia rupestris, commonly known as the rock trimezia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and striking bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring or early summer. Trimezia rupestris is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
